course_title: Memory, Emotion & Social Cognition, and Thinking (STEM)
course_description:
Offered to students in the Cognitive and Computational Sciences concentration and provides foundational knowledge to graduate students in this area.
This course is designed explicitly to integrate several foundational cognitive topics including memory, emotion, and thinking. It will be co-taught by faculty who integrate these topics in the context of both historical foundations and current empirical findings.
sections: Class Nbr: 2669, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 1-3:30p, Instructor: Hamann/Cohen, Status: Open
